DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study test effectiveness training community mental health therapist deliver mental health intervention ASD ( `` AIM HI '' ) study process implement AIM HI community mental health program .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Implementation Mental Health Intervention ASD
DOC.detailed_description: This study randomize controlled effectiveness trial AIM HI ( `` An Individualized Mental Health Intervention ASD '' ) , intervention design specifically implementation community mental health clinic , reduce problem behavior among school-age child autism spectrum disorder ( ASD ) . Although individual component AIM HI well-established evidence-based practice strategy pilot study data indicate child behavior problem decrease community mental health therapist deliver AIM HI , effectiveness protocol establish . Therefore , primary aim test impact training community therapists AIM HI child family outcome determine child/ family characteristic level therapist fidelity moderate treatment effect . The secondary aim collect initial data implementation outcome conduct exploratory analysis identify barrier facilitator AIM HI implementation ( e.g. , intervention , organization , provider characteristic ) . This study potential make significant impact build local capacity serve school-age child ASD routine service setting , advance science effectiveness package evidence-based practice ( EBPs ) specific service setting . It also produce generalizable knowledge implementation apply population/ setting .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Therapists 1 . Employed staff trainee participate clinic ( publiclyfunded mental health program ) 2 . Employed least next 7 month ( i.e. , practicum internship end next 7 month ) . 3 . Has eligible client current caseload ( see ) . Inclusion Criteria Child/ Parent Participants 1 . Child age 513 year . 2 . Has current ASD diagnosis record . 3 . Meets criteria ASD Autism Diagnostic Observation Schedule ( ADOS ) exhibit clinical indicator ASD 4 . English Spanish speaking . Exclusion Criteria Child/ Parent Participants 1 . Child present challenge behavior . 2 . Child meet criterion ASD ADOS exhibit clinical indicator ASD
